* Major League Cricket (MLC) has been granted List-A status by the International Cricket Council (ICC) ahead of its second season, which is set to begin on July 5, 2024. This recognition solidifies MLC's position as America's premier domestic T20 tournament and ensures official career statistics for players.
* Major League Cricket has congratulated the USA Cricket team on their historic T20 World Cup campaign, where they advanced to the Super 8 stage.

The Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament is gaining popularity in the US, particularly among the South Asian diaspora. Franchise backers, such as the S.F. Unicorns, L.A. Knight Riders, and Seattle Orcas, are planning to build dedicated cricket stadiums in their cities. The league's next season is scheduled to start in July, with Grand Prairie, Texas hosting 16 matches, and the city manager expects around 85,000 fans to attend. The MLC's priority is to build 7,000- to 10,000-seat stadiums near vibrant areas that could become entertainment districts. Specific stadium plans include the Orcas building at Marymoor Park in Redmond, Washington, the Knight Riders scoping out a spot at the Great Park in Irvine, California, and the Unicorns proposing a stadium in the Santa Clara County Fairgrounds.

The second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) is scheduled to take place in July. The tournament is expected to have an impact on the game of cricket in the US, following the country's impressive performance in the T20 World Cup 2024.

* Five Indian Premier League (IPL) franchises have expressed interest in acquiring a stake in London Spirit, a team in The Hundred, a cricket tournament in England.
* The IPL franchises already have teams in several T20 leagues across the globe, including the Caribbean Premier League, Major League Cricket, ILT20, and SA20.

* The 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to take place from July 6 to July 29, shortly after the 2024 T20 World Cup.
* The second edition of MLC is expected to feature a significant number of Australian players, including Marcus Stoinis, Glenn Maxwell, and Pat Cummins.
* Travis Head, who was signed by the Washington Freedom, may not participate in the MLC due to Cricket Australia's (CA) hesitation to grant him a No Objection Certificate (NOC) citing a hectic schedule ahead and concerns over his recent form in red-ball cricket.
* The Washington Freedom team is coached by Ricky Ponting and features fellow Australian Steve Smith.
* Defending champions MI New York will face the Seattle Orcas in a rematch of last year's final on July 6.
